issues.title: Add a security consideration on server-generated private keys
issues.author: malishav
issues.body:
Minutes from the ACE wg meeting on 06-June-2023:

>MV (p4): comment on GH issue from MCR. Should we continue supporting server-generated private keys in EST-oscore? The hardware RNG is not enough secure for random number generation.
GS: It’d be good to avoid server-generated keys, but we’d need first to be convinced it’s a bad option to start avoiding. Otherwise we should keep it.
MCR (on chat): I don’t buy the “without an OS” point. If they code bare-metal, then they need to code bare-metal secure RNG, or they will have lots of problems. I haven’t watched this youtube video [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zuqw0-jZh9Y]… are there people in the WG who want server generated keys? Let them stand up. (I don’t object to it, but I question the need).
PW (on chat): I would be okay with a big fat warning that it SHOULD NOT be done unless absolutely no other way possible
MV: So we can go for a big security consideration on this, and fundamentally allow it.
CB: Maybe not a problem anymore with very new platforms, but practically it’s still relevant. Can the server contribute to entropy? It might not fit in this document but still something to think about.
GS (on chat): Something for T2TRG.
CB (on chat): +1
MV: Even renowned manufacturers admit to have vulnerabilities in the secure random number generation.
MV: I hear consensus on keeping the option, and add a big warning in the security considerations.
